birth_place.en: Shuntian Prefecture, North Zhili, Ming Dynasty

death_place.zh-cn: 大明北直隶顺天府紫禁城弘德殿
death_place.en: Hongde Hall, Forbidden City, Shuntian Prefecture, North Zhili, Ming Dynasty

description.zh-cn: 明朝第十三位皇帝，年号万历，是明代在位时间最长的皇帝。在位前期在张居正的辅佐下开创了“万历中兴”，后期因国本之争等问题长期怠政，但仍主持了万历三大征。
description.en: The 13th emperor of the Ming Dynasty, with the era name Wanli, he was the longest-reigning emperor of the Ming Dynasty. During the early part of his reign, under the assistance of Zhang Juzheng, he ushered in the 'Wanli Restoration'. In the later period, due to issues such as the succession dispute, he neglected state affairs for a long time but still presided over the Three Great Campaigns of the Wanli Era.

description.zh-cn: 明朝内阁首辅、政治家、改革家，万历皇帝的老师。在万历初年主持改革，开创“万历中兴”，死后被清算。
description.en: Grand Secretary, statesman, and reformer of the Ming Dynasty, and tutor to the Wanli Emperor. He presided over reforms in the early Wanli era, creating the 'Wanli Restoration', but was posthumously purged.

description.zh-cn: 明神宗在位前十年，由内阁首辅张居正主持改革所出现的短暂的中兴景象。
description.en: A brief period of revival during the first ten years of the Wanli Emperor's reign, brought about by reforms led by Grand Secretary Zhang Juzheng.

description.zh-cn: 指明神宗在位中后期，因国本之争等原因，长期不上朝、不理政事的现象。
description.en: Refers to the period in the middle and late reign of the Wanli Emperor when he refrained from holding court and attending to state affairs for an extended period, largely due to the succession dispute.

description.zh-cn: 指万历年间围绕册立皇太子而引发的、持续多年的政治斗争，是导致万历怠政的主要原因之一。
description.en: A years-long political struggle during the Wanli era over the appointment of the crown prince, which was a major cause of the emperor's negligence of state affairs.

description.zh-cn: 明神宗在位中期，为巩固边防，维护明朝统治，先后在西北、东北、西南边疆进行的三次重大军事行动，包括宁夏之役、朝鲜之役和播州之役。
description.en: Three major military campaigns conducted during the middle of the Wanli Emperor's reign to consolidate border defenses and maintain Ming rule, including the Ningxia Campaign, the Korean Campaign (Imjin War), and the Bozhou Campaign.

description.zh-cn: 意大利耶稣会传教士，明朝末年来华，带来了西方的科学技术，开启了西学东渐的潮流。
description.en: An Italian Jesuit priest who came to China during the late Ming Dynasty, introducing Western science and technology and initiating the trend of 'West-to-East transmission of Western learning'.

description.zh-cn: 明末清初，欧洲的学术思想和科学技术通过传教士传入中国的历史过程。
description.en: The historical process during the late Ming and early Qing dynasties in which European academic thought and scientific technology were introduced to China by missionaries.

description.zh-cn: 由女真族首领努尔哈赤建立的政权，是清朝的前身，明朝末期的主要外部威胁。
description.en: A state established by the Jurchen leader Nurhaci, the predecessor of the Qing Dynasty and a major external threat to the late Ming Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 明朝第十二位皇帝，明神宗的父亲。
description.en: The 12th emperor of the Ming Dynasty, father of the Wanli Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 明神宗的生母，在神宗年幼时垂帘听政。
description.en: The birth mother of the Wanli Emperor, who acted as regent during his childhood.

description.zh-cn: 明神宗长子，明朝第十四位皇帝，年号泰昌，在位仅一个月。
description.en: The eldest son of the Wanli Emperor and the 14th emperor of the Ming Dynasty, with the era name Taichang. He reigned for only one month.

description.zh-cn: 明神宗第三子，其母为郑贵妃。因神宗偏爱，一度成为国本之争的中心人物。
description.en: The third son of the Wanli Emperor, his mother was Noble Consort Zheng. Due to the emperor's favoritism, he became a central figure in the succession dispute.

description.zh-cn: 明神宗的宠妃，朱常洵的生母，国本之争的关键人物。
description.en: The favored consort of the Wanli Emperor, mother of Zhu Changxun, and a key figure in the succession dispute.

description.zh-cn: 明神宗的原配皇后。
description.en: The primary consort and Empress of the Wanli Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 明神宗的皇贵妃，明光宗的生母。
description.en: An Imperial Noble Consort of the Wanli Emperor and the birth mother of the Taichang Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上最后一个由汉族建立的大一统王朝。
description.en: The last imperial dynasty of China established by the Han people.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国于1966年至1976年间发生的一场全国性政治运动。
description.en: A nationwide political movement in the People's Republic of China from 1966 to 1976.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命时期中国青年学生组成的群众性组织，对大量文物古迹造成破坏。
description.en: A mass paramilitary social movement of young people in China, who were mobilized by Mao Zedong in 1966 and 1967, during the Cultural Revolution. They caused significant damage to historical artifacts and sites.

description.zh-cn: 明朝与后金在辽东进行的一场决定性战役，明军大败，是明清兴亡史上的一个重要转折点。
description.en: A decisive battle between the Ming Dynasty and the Later Jin in Liaodong. The Ming forces were defeated, marking a major turning point in the history of the Ming-Qing transition.

description.zh-cn: 万历三大征之一，平定播州土司杨应龙叛乱的战争。
description.en: One of the Three Great Campaigns of the Wanli Era, a war to suppress the rebellion of the Bozhou tusi Yang Yinglong.

description.zh-cn: 明朝末年播州宣慰使，后发动叛乱，在播州之役中被平定。
description.en: The Tusi of Bozhou during the late Ming Dynasty who later launched a rebellion and was suppressed in the Bozhou Campaign.

description.zh-cn: 万历三大征之一，平定宁夏地区哱拜叛乱的战争。
description.en: One of the Three Great Campaigns of the Wanli Era, a war to suppress the rebellion of Bobai in the Ningxia region.

description.zh-cn: 明朝将领，后在宁夏发动叛乱，在宁夏之役中被平定。
description.en: A Ming Dynasty general who later launched a rebellion in Ningxia and was suppressed in the Ningxia Campaign.

description.zh-cn: 万历三大征之一，明朝应朝鲜王朝请求，出兵抵抗日本丰臣秀吉侵略的战争。
description.en: One of the Three Great Campaigns of the Wanli Era, a war in which the Ming Dynasty, at the request of the Joseon Dynasty, sent troops to resist the invasion of Japan under Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

description.zh-cn: 东亚国家，在丰臣秀吉统治时期发动了对朝鲜的侵略战争。
description.en: An East Asian country that launched an invasion of Korea during the rule of Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜半岛历史上的一个王朝，明朝的藩属国，在万历朝鲜之役中受到明朝的援助。
description.en: A dynasty in the history of the Korean Peninsula, a tributary state of the Ming Dynasty, which received aid from the Ming during the Imjin War.

description.zh-cn: 明神宗是明穆宗的第三子。
description.en: The Wanli Emperor was the third son of the Longqing Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 明神宗的生母是孝定皇太后李氏。
description.en: The Wanli Emperor's birth mother was Empress Dowager Xiaoding, née Li.

description.zh-cn: 明光宗朱常洛是明神宗的长子。
description.en: The Taichang Emperor, Zhu Changluo, was the eldest son of the Wanli Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 福王朱常洵是明神宗的第三子。
description.en: Zhu Changxun, the Prince of Fu, was the third son of the Wanli Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 孝端显皇后王氏是明神宗的原配皇后。
description.en: Empress Xiaoduanxian, née Wang, was the primary consort and empress of the Wanli Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 孝靖皇后王氏是明神宗的妃嫔，生育了皇长子朱常洛（后来的明光宗）。
description.en: Empress Xiaojing, née Wang, was a consort of the Wanli Emperor and gave birth to the eldest prince, Zhu Changluo (later the Taichang Emperor).

description.zh-cn: 郑贵妃是明神宗的宠妃，生育了皇三子朱常洵。
description.en: Noble Consort Zheng was the favored consort of the Wanli Emperor and gave birth to the third prince, Zhu Changxun.

description.zh-cn: 明神宗朱翊钧于1572年登基，在位48年，是明朝在位时间最长的皇帝。
description.en: The Wanli Emperor, Zhu Yijun, ascended the throne in 1572 and reigned for 48 years, the longest reign of any Ming Dynasty emperor.

description.zh-cn: 在明神宗即位之初，张居正作为内阁首辅和帝师，主持军政大事，独握大权。
description.en: At the beginning of the Wanli Emperor's reign, Zhang Juzheng, as Grand Secretary and Imperial Tutor, presided over military and state affairs, holding great power.

description.zh-cn: 作为内阁首辅，张居正主持改革，推行一条鞭法等措施，开创了“万历中兴”的局面。
description.en: As Grand Secretary, Zhang Juzheng presided over reforms, implementing policies like the Single-whip law, which led to the 'Wanli Restoration'.

description.zh-cn: 在张居正死后，明神宗下诏追夺其封号和谥号，并查抄其家，对其进行政治清算。
description.en: After Zhang Juzheng's death, the Wanli Emperor issued an edict to posthumously strip him of his titles and honors and confiscate his family's property in a political purge.

description.zh-cn: 因立储问题与内阁的长期争执是导致万历皇帝开始长期倦于朝政，不理政事的主要原因。
description.en: The long-standing dispute with the Grand Secretariat over the issue of succession was the main reason the Wanli Emperor began his long period of negligence of state affairs.

description.zh-cn: 利玛窦于1601年觐见明神宗，并进献自鸣钟等西方方物，获得其信任。
description.en: Matteo Ricci had an audience with the Wanli Emperor in 1601, presenting him with Western objects such as a striking clock, and gained his trust.

description.zh-cn: 利玛窦等传教士将西方科学文化传入中国，开启了西学东渐的潮流。
description.en: Missionaries like Matteo Ricci introduced Western science and culture to China, initiating the 'West-to-East transmission of Western learning'.

description.zh-cn: 1618年，后金首领努尔哈赤以“七大恨”告天，正式起兵反明，双方进入敌对状态。
description.en: In 1618, Later Jin leader Nurhaci declared war on the Ming Dynasty with the 'Seven Grievances', marking the beginning of open hostilities.

description.zh-cn: 明军在萨尔浒之战中大败于后金，精锐损失殆尽，是明清兴亡史上的一个重要转折点。
description.en: The Ming army was decisively defeated by the Later Jin at the Battle of Sarhu, losing its elite forces and marking a major turning point in the Ming-Qing transition.

description.zh-cn: 主持并发动了万历三大征，以维护明朝的内部统一及宗主国权威。
description.en: He presided over and launched the Three Great Campaigns of the Wanli Era to maintain the internal unity and suzerainty of the Ming Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 播州之役是明朝为平定播州土司杨应龙的叛乱而发动的战争，最终杨应龙兵败自杀。
description.en: The Bozhou Campaign was a war launched by the Ming Dynasty to suppress the rebellion of the Bozhou tusi Yang Yinglong, which ended with Yang's defeat and suicide.

description.zh-cn: 宁夏之役是明朝为平定将领哱拜在宁夏发动的叛乱而进行的战争，最终叛乱被平息。
description.en: The Ningxia Campaign was a war conducted by the Ming Dynasty to suppress the rebellion launched by General Bobai in Ningxia, which was ultimately quelled.

description.zh-cn: 明朝应朝鲜请求出兵，成功抵抗了日本丰臣秀吉对朝鲜的侵略。
description.en: At the request of Joseon, the Ming Dynasty sent troops and successfully resisted the invasion of Korea by Japan under Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

description.zh-cn: 明朝出兵援助朝鲜，帮助其抵抗日本侵略，保全了国家。
description.en: The Ming Dynasty sent troops to aid Joseon, helping it resist the Japanese invasion and preserving the nation.

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命期间，红卫兵将明神宗及其皇后的尸骨从定陵中拖出并焚毁。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Red Guards dragged the skeletal remains of the Wanli Emperor and his empresses from the Dingling Mausoleum and burned them.
